Class Interval

java.lang.Object
  Interval

public class Interval
extends Object

Interval

Contains information about Intervals, the distance between Notes

Version:
3.0
Author:
Devon Hubert

Constructor Summary
Interval()
          The default constructor, which sets the Interval's distance to 0, quality to "Perfect," degreeValue to 1, and degreeName to "Unison"
Interval(int distance)
          The constructor that accepts the raw distance between two Notes, and sets it as the Interval's distance
Interval(int degreeValue, int distance)
          The constructor that accepts the Interval's degreeValue and distance, and calculates and sets the remaining variables accordingly
Interval(int distance, String quality)
          The constructor that accepts the Interval's distance and quality, and calculates and sets the remaining variables accordingly
Interval(int distance, String quality, int degreeValue)
          The constructor where all information about the Interval is known, setting the Interval's variables based on the parameter input
Interval(Note firstNote, Note secondNote)
          The constructor that accepts two Notes, calculates their raw distance, and sets this distance as the Interval's distance
Interval(Note firstNote, Note secondNote, int degreeValue)
          The constructor that accepts two Notes, between which the Interval exists, as well as the desired degreeValue of the interval, which are used to calculate and set the remaining variables
Interval(Note firstNote, Note secondNote, String quality)
          The constructor that accepts two Notes, between which the Interval exists, as well as the desired quality of the interval, which are used to calculate and set the remaining variables
Interval(String quality, int degreeValue)
          The constructor that accepts the Interval's quality and degreeValue, and calculates and sets the remaining variables accordingly

Constructor Detail

Interval

public Interval()
The default constructor, which sets the Interval's distance to 0, quality to "Perfect," degreeValue to 1, and degreeName to "Unison"

public Interval(int distance)
The constructor that accepts the raw distance between two Notes, and sets it as the Interval's distance

Parameters:
distance - The raw distance between two Notes

Interval

public Interval(int degreeValue,
                int distance)
The constructor that accepts the Interval's degreeValue and distance, and calculates and sets the remaining variables accordingly

Parameters:
degreeValue - The Interval's degreeValue (third, fourth, ninth, octave, etc.) (int)
distance - The raw distance that the Interval represents (int)

Interval

public Interval(int distance,
                String quality)
The constructor that accepts the Interval's distance and quality, and calculates and sets the remaining variables accordingly

Parameters:
distance - The raw distance that the Interval represents (int)
quality - The Interval's quality ("Perfect," "minor," "diminished," etc.) (String)

Interval

public Interval(int distance,
                String quality,
                int degreeValue)
The constructor where all information about the Interval is known, setting the Interval's variables based on the parameter input

Parameters:
distance - The raw distance that the Interval represents (int)
quality - The Interval's quality ("Perfect," "minor," "diminished," etc.) (String)
degreeValue - The Interval's degreeValue (1 = "unison," 8 = "octave," etc.) (int)

Interval

public Interval(Note firstNote,
                Note secondNote)
The constructor that accepts two Notes, calculates their raw distance, and sets this distance as the Interval's distance

Parameters:
firstNote - The first Note
secondNote - The second Note

Interval

public Interval(Note firstNote,
                Note secondNote,
                int degreeValue)
The constructor that accepts two Notes, between which the Interval exists, as well as the desired degreeValue of the interval, which are used to calculate and set the remaining variables

Parameters:
firstNote - The first Note
secondNote - The second Note
degreeValue - The Interval's degreeValue (third, fourth, ninth, octave, etc.) (int)

Parameters:

secondNote - The second Note
